document.title: DYNAMIC LEARNING MAPS ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

BFD70F9114104082B09776951B6EDE1E.description:
Use general academic and domain-specific
words and phrases across contexts.

C6CD1601F9AF41E692C91CE1C58071B0.description:
Use descriptive words to add meaning when writing and
communicating.

B6661072C7B2496AB1E0624D838822E3.description:
Use knowledge of common words to understand the
meaning of compound and complex words in which they
appear (e.g., birdhouse, household).

74228CBDA9724174A1791ABBF20E49EB.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the use of multiple
meaning words.

C3B5F13EA65A4F069413B0EDE7671F22.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word
relationships and use.

D4C0359BC36948F28AB79132DDC5585D.description:
Seek clarification and meaning support when unfamiliar
words are encountered while reading or communicating.

ED248804C7B342C3A3D9191C60EC5E2D.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., like) and the
words that result when affixes are added (e.g., liked,
disliked, liking).

2F3407CCB5264EBEBA0F1A1889165FB7.description:
Use context to determine which word is missing from a
content area text.

72E7F2A53476492DB3DF8A961BD4F06D.description:
Use to-be verbs (am, are, is, was, were, be, become,
became) accurately when writing and communicating.

A69FC8B79C204E7EA3A80B0909DA76E4.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes
when communicating.

64041CC2F5D446B585AE0F4A6CCBE838.description:
Spell words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of
letter-sound relationships and/or common spelling
patterns.

21928316018E4497864A622F0A6066A8.description:
Use end punctuation and capitalization when writing a
sentence or question.

FBEF2445BC194AC285802A2DB3C1F0F5.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

76F226064B074B2F97B26AFCF0F0C793.description: Use appropriate verbs to match nouns.

8BA8E283BD0549CD90489C59331B8A7F.description:
Form and use the simple verb tenses (e.g., I walked, I
walk, I will walk).

0C8289890F01490A95D9DBDEF03437E1.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

7BA92F30AF74490381B06285C7AEBFE8.description:
Adapt communication to a variety of contexts
and tasks.

C6F32984DB12496AA14E0C40643F86B4.description:
Include multimedia and visual information into
presentations.

A51686407B5F48069A436BF99D39421D.description:
Present descriptions, facts, or details
supporting specific points made on a topic.

84F8AF825D864DA4AE5A1050A3335998.description:
Determine the argument made by a speaker
on a topic.

5D43353D126D47D2889850A118E56160.description:
Determine the purpose of information
presented in graphic, oral, visual, or multimodal formats.

9DBAA9FD7D07490391BBB230D983D2C0.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others in a
discussion and relate it to own ideas.

2D11FBBFAFAC40169019BC0E3704B6DC.description:
Remain on the topic of the discussion when asking or
answering questions or making other contributions to a
discussion.

A230AD538727475EA3763B017B109738.description:
Follow simple rules and carry out assigned roles during
discussions.

F2DD4BD65944415E90A1C9CEC5ADA906.description:
Come to discussions prepared to share information
previously studied.

FB18E018A8C246F0B83F8801475AEDE6.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

9EEEB1050537489B9CF052FCB805D589.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 8 Reading Standards
to informational texts (e.g., “Use relevant and sufficient
evidence for supporting the claims and argument.”).

83C4251CA0CE4216AE1EA3E775EE0EAA.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 8 Reading Standards
to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast themes,
patterns of events, or characters across two or more
stories or dramas.”).

4045D8833BD14F829A71C26A936E587E.description:
Use information from literary and informational
text to support writing.

6B634FC2DEDA42D09D112BE5469372C6.description:
Select quotes providing relevant information
about a topic from multiple print or digital sources.

07302DA10D2544E49403EC2B79F3BC3E.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer and
pose questions based on one source of information.

65408A60BC6544059EF86F7C5AE65983.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

B28E726D3E174B34A1EFA2A860052CC6.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce writing to interact and collaborate with others.

F1767C7465E94E74981DC9299E01A079.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, plan before writing and revise own writing.

F54A5E548943464493D2FDE79296756F.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for the task,
purpose, or audience.

AE3D766DD21549308B092F81840C2309.description:
Use words that describe the feelings of characters or
provide other sensory information about the setting,
experiences, or events.

FA17DCAA2CD946C0B444FC2A2A204894.description:
Use temporal words (e.g., first, then, next) to signal
order.

55F894D8C39443D7AD2C857A299BCCF7.description:
Write a narrative about a real or imagined experience
introducing the experience, at least one character, and
two or more events.

37805B00E65D4DBBA3F69FB2D2C05635.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

A38313B01E73425EBF69FAE708B7F650.description: Use domain specific vocabulary related to the topic.

B2A0DE768BF04706A01BD6471E8D953D.description: Write one or more facts or details related to the topic.

D2EE0850F97146F7AA4BC7DEDF3B6E65.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and write to convey ideas and
information about it including visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate.

1A448D681AAD4FC29527FE6E3B5ADFE3.description: Write to share information supported by details.

508434D48FEC499E8C455E1C9F5D72D5.description: Write reasons to support a claim about a topic or text.

573FC39EA3D144229EB0BBA232211D77.description:
Introduce the claim and provide reasons or pieces of
evidence to support it.

2C41FD95A2EE4A2C9FE4BC1649749B45.description: Write claims about topics or texts.

5774AF0B434448288A30FC33CF4BC180.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
reading or listening to literary nonfiction.

6EB65B827EED49F280D420D5747F4734.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

B4B9F13CAB3746429D26ADBF1E611209.description:
Identify where two different texts on the same
topic differ in their interpretation of the details.

8A30C09E10174E3A9C0BB698F77B5113.description:
Determine the argument made by an author in
an informational text.

BAD5C983F9FD4184969889D528AFF5DB.description:
Determine whether a topic is best presented as
audio, video, multimedia, or text.

570057E4A09F490E84126713503D3409.description:
Determine an author’s purpose or point of view
and identify examples from text that describe or support it.

8BB15FFE081F40369CCA8E9E9B2782B5.description:
Locate the topic sentence and supporting
details in a paragraph.

09057059076B48A9AFDBFC1A0CF5DAE2.description:
Determine connotative meanings of words and
phrases in a text.

2DE7E01827E44FF888E7FC4CA9B25AB0.description:
Recount events in the order they were
presented in the text.

4C7AFF49894C4F7CA83838159976E367.description:
Provide a summary of a familiar informational
text.

4F2112E5B402424B8109C52364B0F793.description:
Cite text to support inferences from
informational text.

DECC27F082C94CD6BFA69EFAF421F71A.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively engaged in reading or listening to stories, dramas, and
poetry

AF1BD37D506C4CECA96E4C4941A3FD72.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

EF538B4FB35847F78F4E69BFCCA900CA.description:
Compare and contrast themes, patterns of
events, or characters across two or more stories or dramas.

5EAEF82F8A4C4B37A021B3B0648B6EAE.description:
Compare and contrast a text version of a story,
drama, or poem with an audio, video, or live version of the
same text.

3A4E49929BD641B88FCD44D364A08C9E.description:
Determine the difference in the points of view
of a character and the audience or reader in a text with
suspense or humor.

4BA42D55126A4028BBFC87EAF66F3281.description:
Compare and contrast the structure of two or
more texts.

3478ED163F464F0188AED1F79F102A6A.description:
Determine connotative meanings of words and
phrases in a text.

9440C5F6C71A414D968DC490B8092E6A.description:
Identify which incidents in a story or drama
lead to subsequent action.

D9BF45E4648E4B15B0C96559FD49758E.description:
Recount an event related to the theme or
central idea, including details about character and setting.

AAEB71EBD02845408C499928A3AFB8F7.description:
Cite text to support inferences from stories and
poems.
